[pre][dom] Cards are not replaced during the "as played" window. The cancelation must be played immediately: no other effects can be used, except for wakes (eg. neither {The Barrens} nor {Dreams of the Sphinx} can be used).
[pre][dom] If the canceled card had a "do not replace until" clause (or alternate replacement like {Steely Tenacity}), that clause is canceled as well and the card is replaced normally.

[pre][dom] The canceled card has still been played. The same reaction or modifier cannot be played again by the same minion. Any card which text prohibits to play more than once cannot be played again.
[pre][dom] If a limited effect is canceled (bleed, additional strike), then the limit is not triggered and another limited effect can be used.
[dom][pre][REACTION] If an action is canceled, it is not performed and the minion is free to attempt the same action again.
[dom][pre][REACTION] Can only cancel minion cards played from the hand in the normal fashion (eg. can't cancel allies played via {Piper}).
[dom][pre][REACTION] Can be used to cancel all action cards, including employ retainer, recruit ally and political action.
[dom][pre][REACTION] Cancelation must be immediate: a wake can be used in the "as played" window, but a reaction to "unlock and attempt to block" cannot.

The card on it cannot be discarded or burned to satisfy another effect (eg. {Tension in the Ranks} or using political action cards for votes).

100658.text: Erosion resets a minion's base strength. Any modifiers, including inherent modifiers, are applied to the new base. If another effect like {Torn Signpost} later resets the base damage again, then the new amount wins out.

If his strike resolves, he cannot be saved from burning (with eg. {Heaven's Gate} of {Left for Dead}).

100665.text: You cannot use the effect to burn the card and the vampire if the vampire is no longer in play to be burned.

Cards are not replaced during the "as played" window. The cancelation must be played immediately: no other effects can be used, except for wakes (eg. neither {The Barrens} nor {Dreams of the Sphinx} can be used).
If the canceled card had a "do not replace until" clause (or alternate replacement like {Steely Tenacity}), that clause is canceled as well and the card is replaced normally.
The canceled card has still been played. The same reaction or modifier cannot be played again by the same minion. Any card which text prohibits to play more than once cannot be played again.
If a limited effect is canceled (bleed, additional strike), then the limit is not triggered and another limited effect can be used.
[MAL] If an action is canceled, it is not performed and the minion is free to attempt the same action again.

[MAL] Can be used to cancel all action cards, including employ retainer, recruit ally and political action.
[MAL][REACTION] Cancelation must be immediate: a wake can be used in the "as played" window, but a reaction to "unlock and attempt to block" cannot.

Is a temporary effect that overrides the underlying sect. The most recent override takes precedence, but if a more recent would set the sect to Camarilla, it sets it to Independent instead while the Fall is in play. If the Fall leaves play, the vampire retrieves his underlying sect.
Vampires with a Camarilla title lose the benefit from it until they becomre Camarilla again. They immediately yield the title if it is contested or if they receives a new one.
An "impersonator" (eg. {Vlad Tepes}) can still play cards requiring Camarilla or a Camarilla title.
The "other Gehenna cards in play" requirement is only checked when playing the card.

G00043.text: The scarce penalty considers the apparent clan while controlled (in case of {Clan Impersonation} and {Banishment}).

G00045.text: A second copy allows a second use in the same combat.

G00046.text: A second copy allows a second use in the same round.

G00047.text: May be put on any minion if the controller changes. If the new controller has no minions, it is burned.
An action targeting it (eg. {Conceal}) is directed at the Methuselah controlling it, not the minion it is on. "
Is an equipment while in hand, library or ash heap, both equipment and location when played (eg. for cost-related effects), and just a location while in play.

G00050.text: "Before resolution" means after strikes have been declared but before they resolve.
Cannot be played on an opponent's weapon.

G00052.text: Must be played (as well as other "as the action is announced" action modifiers) before action modifiers that are not explicitly played "as the action is announced" (e.g., {Conditioning}).
Replace the action card (if any) before playing it.

G00054.text: Is not a vampire in the ash heap (eg. {Possession} cannot target it).
If moved to the uncontrolled region (eg. by {Banishment}), it stays a vampire and can be influenced.
If it would be put into the crypt for any reason, it is burned instead

G00056.text: If burned and shuffled into the library, other effects that apply when it is burned still apply (eg. {Set's Curse} puts an ally into play).
Is not shuffled into the library when it is discarded.

G00058.text: Cards are not replaced during the "as played" window. The cancelation must be played immediately: no other effects can be used, except for wakes (eg. neither {The Barrens} nor {Dreams of the Sphinx} can be used).
If the canceled card had a "do not replace until" clause (or alternate replacement like {Steely Tenacity}), that clause is canceled as well and the card is replaced normally.
The canceled card has still been played. The same reaction or modifier cannot be played again by the same minion. Any card which text prohibits to play more than once cannot be played again.
If a limited effect is canceled (bleed, additional strike), then the limit is not triggered and another limited effect can be used.

G00060.text: [abo] [REFLEX] Any frenzy card that targets/selects/chooses/affects the minion when played, is considered being played on the minion.

G00061.text: If an action is canceled, it is not performed and the minion is free to attempt the same action again.
Can only cancel minion cards played from the hand in the normal fashion (eg. can't cancel allies played via {Piper}).
Can be used to cancel all action cards, including employ retainer, recruit ally and political action.

G00062.text: Cancelation must be immediate: a wake can be used in the "as played" window, but a reaction to "unlock and attempt to block" cannot.

G00063.text: Can be used if there is no action, but that allowance does not extend to other reactions (eg. wake effects).

G00064.text: A minion can only perform this special hunt once per turn.

G00065.text: The burn blood effect is not reduced by effects that reduce the cost of the card (eg. {Adana de Sforza}).

G00066.text: Changing the controller of a location has no other effect, unless specified by card text. Exception: A location "on" another controlled card is moved onto an appropriate card controlled by the new controller of the location.

G00067.text: Can be used when stealth is not yet needed. Any stealth that would be gained is not gained (as no stealth is needed).

G00068.text: Keeps their title and votes if they changes sects.

G00069.text: When meeting a title requirement for a political action, the vampire does not get the title's votes for the subsequent referendum.

G00070.text: Can meet a sect-specific title (e.g. Justicar) requirement even if the sect does not exist anymore (eg. {Fall of the Camarilla}).

G00071.text:
If the combat continues or a new combat begins, the after combat effect does not happen/is not usable (e.g. {Psyche!}, {Telepathic Tracking}).
(Partial reversal of RTR 20010711)

G00072.text: The ability ability cannot be used to fulfill card requirements if they are not played normally, like when using {Concealed Weapon} for an equipment or {Piper} or {The Summoning} for an ally.

G00073.text: When meeting a requirement to play a card, the vampire is treated as such for all the effects of the card, and only them, including duration effects. The vampire is not treated as meeting the requirements for effects the card has from being in play.

G00074.text: If an effect granting a strike is played/used before another effect that adds a cost to strike (e.g. {Lucian, the Perfect}, {Dam the Heart's River}), you may choose not to strike.
If an effect granting a strike (e.g. {.44 Magnum}) is played/used after another effect that adds a cost to strike, you must pay the additional cost to use that first effect.

Strikes are paid at declaration. If an ally spends their last life on a strike, combat ends before strike resolution. If the strike damage depends on the amount of life/blood of the striking minion, it is calculated after the strike is paid for (e.g. {Shambling Hordes}).

G00075.text: The discount applies to the action, regardless of who pays.

G00076.text: Is affected by {Blood Cult Awareness Network}

G00077.text: The after action resolution effect can be used if the action "fizzles" (is unblocked at resolution, but has no effect because some requirement cannot be met or cost can't be paid in full).

G00078.text: If the action is unblocked when it resolves and the target is unlocked, the action "fizzles" (cost, if any, is paid, and it is considered successful, but has no effect).

G00079.text: When the acting vampire leaves torpor before the action resolves (e.g. {Warsaw Station}) the action immediately "fizzles" (cost, if any, is paid, and it is considered successful, but has no effect).

G00080.text: If the action is unblocked when it resolves and the target is no longer in torpor, the action "fizzles" (cost, if any, is paid, and it is considered successful, but has no effect).

G00081.text: If the action is unblocked when it resolves and the target is locked, the action "fizzles" (cost, if any, is paid, and it is considered successful, but has no effect).

G00082.text: You still gain the trifle master phase action, even if this card contests when played.

G00083.text: Does not stack with similar effects (or another copy of itself) to provide superior version of the discipline(s) (e.g. {Leech} and {Putrescent Servitude} together does not provide superior [POT])

G00084.text: Can be used to meet one (but not more than one) of the normal Discipline requirements of a multi-Discipline card.

G00085.text: While a minion has an effect that allows them to play cards that require Discipline(s), they do not actually have those Discipline(s).

Multiple similar effects (e.g. two {Infernal Familiar}, or {Ian Forestal} with an {Infernal Familiar}) cannot be used to meet the requirements of a multi-Discipline card that the minion is missing one or more Disciplines to play.

G00086.text: When played, a multi-Disciplines card counts as requiring the Discipline(s) being used. In the hand, library, or ash heap, the card is considered to require any and/or all Disciplines listed on it.

G00087.text: Is played after the referendum is resolved. If the effect of the referendum ousts the acting Methuselah, there is no time to play it to prevent the ousting.
Can be used after a referendum that is automatically passing, but the vote is considered to have passed by 0 votes.

G00088.text: A minion previously attempting to block can resign his attempt and pay no blood.

G00089.text: The card must be present in the ash heap to be redrawn.
If the card is cancelled, the self-replacing clause is also cancelled.
If an effect delays when the redraw occurs (e.g. {The Meddling of Semsith}), you can still redraw this card from the ash heap when the delay effect allows a redraw.
If an effect prevents replacement ({Visit from the Capuchin}), then there is no opportunity to use the cards replacement text.

G00090.text: Any blood loss occurs after combat (and will not trigger {Anathema} or be available for {Taste of Vitae}, etc).

G00091.text: Damage is applied after combat, so cannot be prevented by combat cards.
Is a damage dealing effect and can be modified by other effects like {Dam the Heart's River}.

G00092.text: The fact it is Unique has no bearing on the burn option. You cannot use the burn option if you meet the requirement, even if you already have a copy of the card in play.

G00093.text: Minions that cannot strike, cannot play or use the maneuver from a strike (e.g. {.44 Magnum}, {Thrown Gate}).
Minions can (uselessly) gain additional strikes even if they cannot strike.

G00094.text: The option to place the card on another minion can only be used when playing the card normally; for any other action or put into play effect, the card is placed on the playing minion.
The type of the action (equip/employ) does not change regardless of the target.

G00095.text: Ignores all "do not replace" clauses and special replacement effects on cards played from it.
The card on it cannot be discarded or burned to satisfy another effect (eg. {Tension in the Ranks} or using political action cards for votes).

G00096.text: The optional press can only be used during the current round.

G00097.text: The card cannot be played if the minion cannot afford to burn the blood.

G00098.text: An action cannot continue "as if unblocked" after a combat resulting from a successful action (e.g. {Bum's Rush}).

G00099.text: If the action continues "as if unblocked", all action modifiers and reaction cards are still in effect, even those pertaining to a successful block.
If the action continues "as if unblocked", any Methuselahs that have declined to block before do not get another opportunity to block.

For actions resulting from an action card, "continue as if unblocked" moves the action card from the ash heap (where it went when the action was blocked) to limbo (where it should be if the action is not blocked). If the action card is not in the ash heap, then the action cannot be continued.

G00101.text: The provided press is applied before any other press. Another press cannot be used to continue (eg. {Boxed In}, {Talbot's Chainsaw}) if there's already a press to continue.

G00102.text: Can be played any time during the action before resolution; a block attempt is not required.

G00103.text: Sequencing rules apply. You must gain the impulse to be able to use the reaction, or use the effect (whichever is applicable).  Other Methuselahs must declare block attempts (or not) and pass the impulse to you as normal.

G00104.text: Can be played/used any time during the action before resolution; a block attempt is not required.

G00105.text: If the action is blocked, *all* effects that would be triggered by a successful block (eg. {Banshee Ironwail}) must be applied (ordered by the acting Methuselah).  Other effects and modifiers (eg. {Crypt's Sons}, {Change of Target}) can only be used after all triggered effects have been handled.

G00106.text: Can be used when failing to block because of stealth: it is still declining to block.

Must be used before action resolution, ie. before any modifier or reaction played "as the action/bleed would be successful" are played. It cannot be played after a {Spying Mission} on the vampire triggers.
Cannot be used to direct a bleed to a Methuselah who would be an invalid target for a bleed.

G00107.text: The passive ability applies even if the vampire is in torpor.

G00108.text: If used to steal a vampire in combat, combat ends. Any damage yet to resolve still resolves before the change of control.
If used to steal a minion attempting to block, the block attempt fails.

If used to steal a minion during an action, Methuselahs who declined to block are still declining to block. The new controller, if he is eligible and has not declined to block yet, can block with the stolen minion even if the previous controller has declined to block.

If used to steal a minion targeted by an action, the action continues with the same target. Methuselahs who declined to block do not get another opportunity. If the target is not legal anymore (eg. [DOM] {Slaughtering the Herd}), the action fizzles (ends successfully with no effect).
Can be used to take control of the target at any point during the appropriate minion phase. It does not have to be done before non-mandatory actions.

G00109.text: Does not prevent the opponent from dodging, the dodge just has no effect.

G00110.text: Cards requiring a discipline come in play at the inferior version.
Requirements do not apply. If the cost is X (e.g. {Reanimated Corpse}), X is zero. If the effect puts/moves a minion into the ready region, that minion can act this turn.

G00111.text: The ally counts as "independent" when playing cards as a vampire

G00112.text: The ability to make the damage from the vampire's strikes aggravated that round must be used before strike resolution and damage prevention in order to affect the current strike. Can be played after both strikes have been chosen.

G00113.text: If an {Agent of Power} is choosen its card text is not appled. The created vampire has no dsiciplines, is still non-unique and does not burn in your discard phase.

G00114.text: The effect in the press step does not happen if the combat ends prematurely (e.g. from torpor or "strike: combat ends").

G00115.text: The minion need not attempt to block nor play further reaction cards: that is merely an option.
Can be played or used after action resolution (e.g. to use a reaction card like {Fast Reaction} after combat).
Can be played or used during the “as a card is played” window, except in combat, or when there is no action.

G00116.text: If an acting minion leaves the ready region before block resolution, the action ends immediately and the blocking minion is not locked.

G00117.text: The ability to increase bleed can only be used during a bleed action before Action Resolution.

G00118.text: The "can act the turn it is recruited" text does not let him act during an opponent's turn if it was recruited then (eg. using {Enkil Cog}).

G00119.text: They can lock to use their ability the turn they where recruited.

G00120.text: Other non-standard hunt actions are still permitted (e.g. {Abactor}). When performing such actions, their text apply: this card does not combine with them.

G00121.text: This special hunt cannot steal more blood than the target has. It can target a vampire with no blood. If no blood is stolen, the hunt is unsuccessful, even if the action stays successful.
The blood stolen by this special hunt goes to the blood bank if it cannot be gained by the vampire.
This special hunt must be directed at a vampire, even if none has any blood. It cannot be performed if there are no other vampires.
Is affected by Hunt value. All blood that is gained from the Hunt is taken from the target minion. ({Festivo dello Estinto} is not blood gained from the hunt)

G00122.text: Is an undirected action, even when targeting another Methuselah's ash heap.
Cannot be played if no target is available in any Methuselah's ash heap.

G00123.text: If the action lacks a suitable target because of the unlock (e.g. {Ambush}), the block attempt still happens, as does the resulting combat if the block is successful.

G00124.text: Can be used by a vampire who is already attempting to block.
Cannot be used if the vampire cannot attempt to block the action (eg. {Daring the Dawn}).
Does not ignore the normal prey, predator or target restrictions.

G00125.text: Both the card in the ash heap and the card in hand have to be named when announcing the action or effect.

G00126.text: Cannot be played when the target crypt is empty.

G00127.text: Once the range is set, no other effect can be used to reset the range that round, but other pre-range effects can be played afterwards. Skip the Determine Range step for that round.
If another effect was already setting that round's range (e.g. {Neutral Guard}), that effect has priority.

G00128.text: The equipment or retainer must be announced by name, and in hand, when the card or effect is declared (before the card, if any, is replaced), but need not to be shown until the effect resolves.

G00129.text: If the round ends before range is determined (e.g. {Alpha Glint}) Range is assumed to be at default (usually close, unless e.g. [dai]{Fear of the Void Below} was played), unless range was set by another effect (e.g. {Sniper Rifle}, [obe]{Neutral Guard})

G00130.text: Can be locked to reduce the cost at any point before resolution, from when the action is announced to just before the cost is paid. If it is used when announcing an action, and the action is cancelled as played (e.g. {Direct Intervention}), it is not locked.
Can reduce the cost of an action card even if it is not played as an action (e.g. a weapon played with {Concealed Weapon} or an Ally with {Piper}).
Allows to play a card that could otherwise not be afforded, in which case, it must be locked when the action is announced.

G00131.text: Requirements apply but do not count as requirements for the action (eg. you cannot use CrimethInc. if the card requires an Anarch).

This does not count as performing the action to employ/recruit/equip this retainer/ally/equipment in respect to section 3 of the rules. The same vampire can play the respective card in a normal fashion during their turn, if unlocked.
This is not an action, so cost reductions referring to an action do not apply.  (e.g. {Charisma}, {Erichtho})
The card is not "played" by the minion (e.g. {Louhi}'s ability cannot cancel it).
Cost reductions that are not referring to an action apply .

G00132.text: Does not prevent the acting vampire from playing the equipment/retainer/ally directly this turn if he unlocks (not the same action).
Requirements apply but do not count as requirements for the action (eg. you cannot use {CrimethInc.} if the chosen card requires an Anarch).
When choosing a card whose effect depend on Discipline level, the vampire decides in respect to his disciplines the normal way.
Is an action of the appropriate type for the chosen card (recruit/employ/equip).

G00133.text: Does not prevent the acting ally from playing the equipment directly this turn if he unlocks (not the same action).
Their special is an equip action.

G00135.text: Can allocate more points than a Methuselah has pool.

G00136.text: If a minion who is attempting to block is locked, then that block will fail, unless they woke earlier during the action.

G00137.text:
The affected minion cannot play a card that provides an additional strike, even if just to benefit from another effect (e.g.
{Acrobatics}).

G00138.text: The action provided by this card is considered to be an action requiring the listed clan/sect/capacity/title (e.g. the action provided by {Open War} is considered an action that requires an Anarch, the action provided by {The Gate of Acheron} is considered an action that requires Hecata).

G00139.text: The action provided by the equipment to the attached minion fizzles (resolves successfully for no effect) if the equipment is not attached to the acting minion when the action resolves unblocked.

101519.text: If one is ousted while having temporary control of a minion, the minion is removed from the game.  (Reversal of Previous Rulings)
The stolen minion is removed from the game when he should return to a Methuselah who has been ousted.
The stolen minion returns to his previous controller even if he is in torpor/incapacitated (but stays in torpor/incapacitated).

100033.text: If they use their last life to play an action modifier, the action fails. If they use their last life to play a strike, combat ends before strike resolution.
If they takes aggravated damage from a card they plays as a vampire (eg. {Burst of Sunlight}), they lose one life but do not go to torpor.
If they use their last life to pay for an action, the action still resolves fully. If that leads to an oust, the oust is resolved before resolving effects triggered by the fact that they burn.
If a card they play as a vampire sends them to torpor (eg. {Reform Body}), they burn. REVERSAL of previous rulings.
They cannot use a card to commit diablerie (eg. {Amaranth})
If burned and shuffled into the library, other effects that apply when it is burned still apply (eg. {Set's Curse} puts an ally into play).
Is not shuffled into the library when it is discarded.
The ally counts as "independent" when playing cards as a vampire

Cards are not replaced during the "as played" window. The cancelation must be played immediately: no other effects can be used, except for wakes (eg. neither {The Barrens} nor {Dreams of the Sphinx} can be used).
If the canceled card had a "do not replace until" clause (or alternate replacement like {Steely Tenacity}), that clause is canceled as well and the card is replaced normally.
The canceled card has still been played. The same reaction or modifier cannot be played again by the same minion. Any card which text prohibits to play more than once cannot be played again.
If a limited effect is canceled (bleed, additional strike), then the limit is not triggered and another limited effect can be used.
If an action is canceled, it is not performed and the minion is free to attempt the same action again.
Can only cancel minion cards played from the hand in the normal fashion (eg. can't cancel allies played via {Piper}).
Can be used to cancel all action cards, including employ retainer, recruit ally and political action.

If the action continues "as if unblocked", all action modifiers and reaction cards are still in effect, even those pertaining to a successful block.
If the action continues "as if unblocked", any Methuselahs that have declined to block before do not get another opportunity to block.

For actions resulting from an action card, "continue as if unblocked" moves the action card from the ash heap (where it went when the action was blocked) to limbo (where it should be if the action is not blocked). If the action card is not in the ash heap, then the action cannot be continued.

100178.text: Cards are not replaced during the "as played" window. The cancelation must be played immediately: no other effects can be used, except for wakes (eg. neither {The Barrens} nor {Dreams of the Sphinx} can be used).
If the canceled card had a "do not replace until" clause (or alternate replacement like {Steely Tenacity}), that clause is canceled as well and the card is replaced normally.
The canceled card has still been played. The same reaction or modifier cannot be played again by the same minion. Any card which text prohibits to play more than once cannot be played again.
If a limited effect is canceled (bleed, additional strike), then the limit is not triggered and another limited effect can be used.

100603.text: A minion can only perform this special hunt once per turn.

101086.text: A minion can only perform this special hunt once per turn.
Other non-standard hunt actions are still permitted (e.g. {Abactor}). When performing such actions, their text apply: this card does not combine with them.
This special hunt cannot steal more blood than the target has. It can target a vampire with no blood. If no blood is stolen, the hunt is unsuccessful, even if the action stays successful.
The blood stolen by this special hunt goes to the blood bank if it cannot be gained by the vampire.
This special hunt must be directed at a vampire, even if none has any blood. It cannot be performed if there are no other vampires.
Is affected by Hunt value. All blood that is gained from the Hunt is taken from the target minion. ({Festivo dello Estinto} is not blood gained from the hunt)

[MYT] Sequencing rules apply. You must gain the impulse to be able to use the reaction, or use the effect (whichever is applicable).  Other Methuselahs must declare block attempts (or not) and pass the impulse to you as normal.

100771.text: The burn blood effect is not reduced by effects that reduce the cost of the card (eg. {Adana de Sforza}).

[PRO] If the combat continues or a new combat begins, the after combat effect does not happen/is not usable (e.g. {Psyche!}, {Telepathic Tracking}).
(Partial reversal of RTR 20010711)
[PRO] An action cannot continue "as if unblocked" after a combat resulting from a successful action (e.g. {Bum's Rush}).
[PRO] If the action continues "as if unblocked", all action modifiers and reaction cards are still in effect, even those pertaining to a successful block.
[PRO] If the action continues "as if unblocked", any Methuselahs that have declined to block before do not get another opportunity to block.

[PRO] For actions resulting from an action card, "continue as if unblocked" moves the action card from the ash heap (where it went when the action was blocked) to limbo (where it should be if the action is not blocked). If the action card is not in the ash heap, then the action cannot be continued.

100045.text: If the action continues "as if unblocked", all action modifiers and reaction cards are still in effect, even those pertaining to a successful block.
If the action continues "as if unblocked", any Methuselahs that have declined to block before do not get another opportunity to block.

For actions resulting from an action card, "continue as if unblocked" moves the action card from the ash heap (where it went when the action was blocked) to limbo (where it should be if the action is not blocked). If the action card is not in the ash heap, then the action cannot be continued.
The action provided by the equipment to the attached minion fizzles (resolves successfully for no effect) if the equipment is not attached to the acting minion when the action resolves unblocked.
